page.title: 03 CUSTOMS IN GRAVESEND
page.content: IN GRAVESEND WE HAVE MANY CUSTOMS AND TRADITIONS.ON THE RIVER THAMES A FERRY HAS RUN FOR YEARS,LINKING GRAVESEND WITH TILBURY IN ESSEX.MANY PEOPLE USED THE FERRY TO GO TO ESSEX IN THE PAST, BUT NOW IT IS USED LITTLE AND COSTS A GREAT DEAL FOR A JOURNEY. MANY OF THE WHARFS AND PIERS ARE STILL IN USE,BUT THE RIVER IS NOT USED AS MUCH AS IT WAS.GRAVESEND STILL HAS TUGS TO SEE THE LARGE SHIPS IN AND OUT OF THE ESTUARY.ON NEW YEARS EVE IT IS A CUSTOM FOR TUGS AND SHIPS TO SOUND THE NEW YEAR IN. TWO REGATTAS ARE HELD IN GRAVESEND IN SUMMER,A BIG TOWN REGATTA,AND A SHRIMPERS REGATTA.LOCAL ORGANISATIONS AND RIVER MEN HOLD RACES ON THE THAMES. FOOTBALL TEAMS,CLUBS,FACTORIES AND YOUTH CLUBS COMPETE FOR TROPHIES IN ROWING AND SAILING.
